title: Social Democratic Party of Macedonia
text:
The Social Democratic Party of Macedonia (, "Socijal-demokratska partija na Makedonija", SDPM) is a political party in <a href="North%20Macedonia">North Macedonia</a>.
History.
Established in 1990, the SDPM was the first political party to register in Macedonia, with <a href="Slavko%20Milosavlevski">Slavko Milosavlevski</a> becoming its founding president. It contested the <a href="1990%20Macedonian%20parliamentary%20election">1990 parliamentary elections</a>, at a time when Macedonia was still part of <a href="Socialist%20Federal%20Republic%20of%20Yugoslavia">Yugoslavia</a>. It received 1.6% of the vote in the first round and 0.2 in the second, failing to win a seat. It also ran in alliance with the <a href="Liberal%20Party%20of%20Macedonia">Union of Reform Forces</a> in some areas, but the alliance failed to win a seat.
Despite seeing its vote share fall to 1.2% in the first round of the <a href="1994%20Macedonian%20general%20election">1994 elections</a>, the party managed to win a single seat in the <a href="Assembly%20of%20the%20Republic%20of%20Macedonia">Assembly</a>.
The SDPM did not contest the <a href="1998%20Macedonian%20parliamentary%20election">1998 elections</a>, but returned to run in the <a href="2002%20Macedonian%20parliamentary%20election">2002 elections</a>. However, the party received just 0.3% of the vote and failed to win a seat. The <a href="2006%20Macedonian%20parliamentary%20election">2006 elections</a> saw the party increase its vote share to 0.9%, but it remained seatless. In the <a href="2008%20Macedonian%20parliamentary%20election">2008 elections</a> its vote share fell to 0.65%, as the party again failed to win a seat. In the <a href="2011%20Macedonian%20parliamentary%20election">2011 elections</a> the party's vote share fell to just 0.2%. The <a href="2014%20Macedonian%20general%20election">2014 elections</a> saw it receive 0.4% of the vote, but it remained seatless.
